data.title: Among Us Wiki
data.meta_description: Colors change the appearance of the characters in Among Us. Only one character can have each color in the same lobby. Players are able to select between 18 different colors using the wardrobe: Red, Blue, Green, Pink, Orange, Yellow, Black, White, Purple, Brown, Cyan, Lime, Maroon, Rose, Banana...
data.text:
Colors change the appearance of the characters in Among Us. Only one character can have each color in the same lobby.

Overview[]

Players are able to select between 18 different colors using the wardrobe: Red, Blue, Green, Pink, Orange, Yellow, Black, White, Purple, Brown, Cyan, Lime, Maroon, Rose, Banana, Gray, Tan and Coral. The player's selected color does not directly affect gameplay, and only directly affects the player's in-game appearance. The only 2 exception are a saturated Yellow and Fortegreen. Fortegreen, is not legitimately playable in-game and causes numerous bugs when played as. Saturated Yellow is a chat visual bug that can not be played as nor seen outside of chat, and is generated when Fortegreen attempts to chat. Each color also has a unique color ID; for example, Red's is 0, and Gray's is 15. Fortegreen was an exception to this rule, as it occupied all IDs of whole numbers above 11, examples being 12 and 100, though as of version 2021.2.21, Fortegreen's color ID was removed from the code, so it can no longer be accessed by ID. However, it can still be accessed when joining a lobby (appearing as Fortegreen briefly), selecting a color as someone with that color joins, or as a side effect of another bug.

Since version 2022.6.21, a "Colorblind Text" option can be toggled in the settings menu. When enabled, color names are made visible during gameplay and are displayed over their respective character sprites as well as in the chat and during emergency meetings. This is so that colorblind people can figure out who killed someone when they witness a kill, or maybe call someone out for being suspicious.

List of the Colors[]

Image Name Color ID Red 0 Blue 1 Green 2 Pink 3 Orange 4 Yellow 5 Black 6 White 7 Purple 8 Brown 9 Cyan 10 Lime 11 Maroon 12 Rose 13 Banana 14 Gray 15 Tan 16 Coral 17

Unavailable or Unused Colors[]

Image Name Color ID Fortegreen -

18 or more (only in account settings and wardrobe) Olive - Saturated Yellow -

Trivia[]

There are eight colors that were added after Among Us's initial release.

Cyan and Lime were added in version 2019.4.24.[1]

Six new colors were confirmed for a future Among Us update in the Innersloth Discord server.[2] This update was implemented to the game on June 15, 2021. Those colors ended up being Maroon, Tan, Banana, Gray, Rose, and Coral.

On Discord, a tiebreaker vote between Coral and Olive started on April 20, 2021, and ended roughly 28 hours later.[3] After the vote ended, Coral was deemed the winner.

On May 20, 2021, Innersloth confirmed another new color, Rose, on the Discord server and Twitter. They also announced more information to be announced during the Summer Game Fest on June 10.[4]

On May 26, 2021, Gray was confirmed to be added by Innersloth on the Discord server and Twitter.[5]

On June 3, 2021, Tan's readdition was confirmed by Innersloth on Twitter and Discord, with a trailer.[6]

On June 8, 2021, a couple days later, Maroon was confirmed as an upcoming color by Innersloth on their official Discord server and Twitter account.[7]

On June 10, 2021, during the Summer Game Fest, a color called Banana was confirmed.[8]

Fortegreen and Olive are the only colors that cannot be selected in the wardrobe, due to being unused or unavailable.

However, these color IDs result from Fortegreen being Among Us's failsafe color.

Tan is the only color that was temporarily removed from Among Us. During the removal period, it was still officially recognized in the Innersloth Discord server as a custom emoji, and it has since been added back.

Similarly, Cyan was used in a prototype for Among Us, but removed from its original release. It was later added back along with Lime.

If the player's selected color ID is anything but a whole number, it will be set to a random value between 0 and 17.

Some cosmetics change their appearance based on the player's selected color. These cosmetics include the Mini Crewmate hat, Mini Crewmate pet, and We All Float Here.

Three more cosmetics, the Imp-ressive, Lollipop, and Batty, have this ability as well, but only if their "Crewcolor" variants are selected. They do not have this ability by default.

If the player is playing as Fortegreen, then these cosmetics will take the appearance of Red's.

Contrary to what many people believe, the player's color does not affect the chances of them becoming An Impostor.
